metadata.title: CVE-2018-14653 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: The Gluster file system through versions 4.1.4 and 3.12 is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow in the '__server_getspec' function via the 'gf_getspec_req' RPC message. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service or other potential unspecified impact. It was discovered that GlusterFS incorrectly handled RPC requests. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
